title: CryptoHeadlineNews
author: CryptoHeadlineNews
content: In this thread I was able to use some photos, edit, create and illustrate the way we act on the forum, ranging from all ranks but in a form of meme which could at least spicy your day, make you laugh and make you smile, because just like they always said â€œall work and no play makes Jack a dull boyâ€. So this tread was created to put smile on your faces and illustrate some concepts in a different way, which I will be describing a bit about each as the list keeps unfoldingâ€¦1.Â Â Â This illustrate the expression on most individuals face when been caught for plagiarism on the forum which is highly prohibited2.Â Â Â This illustrate how Hhampuz happens to be to only current user with most active campaigns on the forum and as such the queue anticipating for his/her campaigns always much3.Â Â Â This illustrate the most rated campaigns to the least with reference to the size of the ladies 4.Â Â Â The illustrate the faces and feelings most users keep when they finally not get chosen for a campaign blaming themselves that what could be wrong.5.Â Â Â This illustrate that special feelings each users get when they finally receive their first 1 merit, 100 merits and 1000 merits6.Â Â Â This illustrate that special joy and feeling that comes to our face when we receive a campaign payment7.Â Â Â This illustrate that sad face we ironically keep when our posted thread gets no merit after 24hrs8.Â Â Â This illustrate that untold truth most users face in their early stages on the forum struggling to write a good quality thread/post9.Â Â Â This illustrate how it has become a habit for most Newbies coming to teach us how to get what they donâ€™t actually have (isâ€™t that funny?.. it is truly funny)10.Â Â Â This illustrate how most Newbies think there exist an easy way to gets merits and when they finally noticed its not possible, quit11.Â Â Â This illustrate how most Legendary see all Newbies as people who donâ€™t know anything about bitcoin and cryptocurrency, forgetting the fact that one could be a Newbie on the forum and an experience bitcoin lover 12.Â Â Â This illustrate most rated and least rated campaign on the forum13.Â Â Â This illustrate the most worthy campaigns with reference cars (self explanatory)14.Â Â Â This illustrate the feelings and faces we keep when the price of Bitcoin rises and falls15.Â Â Â This illustrate how the bounty board on the forum happens to be the place with the most users compared to the main reason for the forum16.Â Â Â This illustrate the hierarchy of the forum starting from its founder 17.Â Â Â This illustrate how there exist more shit-post compared to good quality post 18.Â Â Â This illustrate that face most users keep when moderator deletes their post19.Â Â Â This illustrate how Satoshi deserves a salute for his awesome project (Bitcoin)Â  Â  Â  Â  Â I created all these myself, and I hope they are cool. Thanks

comments.author: Chlotide
comments.body: 20. "This illustrate the expression on most" users that try to make posts thinking ONLY of 4 things: minimun 200 characters for campaign, need merit, need to rank up to get $5 more from campaign and the post needs to at least look like it has some value...21. "This illustrate the expression" when asked a harder question about bitcoin or blockchain

comments.author: indah rezqi
comments.body: This thread: Bitcointalk Memes! is still pretty good and deserves to save more bitcointalk related memes. So I don't think a new thread is needed.My advice, lock your thread and start posting all the memes there.

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.created_time: July 19, 2022, 10:05:03 PMLast edit: July 19, 2022, 10:15:30 PM by CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Quote from: indah rezqi on July 19, 2022, 09:20:15 PMThis thread: Bitcointalk Memes! is still pretty good and deserves to save more bitcointalk related memes. So I don't think a new thread is needed.My advice, lock your thread and start posting all the memes there.I think this thread is a bit different from the one you made reference to, the concept is different and as such, it's okay the way it is, no need of locking it, because that thread is just a collection of Bitcointalk memes alone without explanation which am not sure if it was originally created by those users themselves, but this thread is different as it has a brief hint on each meme. So I will love if the thread continue as users come to post self created memes with brief explanation.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: I don't have the talent to create memes, but if I did I'd make one that represented "When a long-time member sees a thread started in an obvious attempt to earn merits".None of the above "memes" are in the least bit funny to me, OP.Â  No offense, and I'm sure you worked really hard at producing those, and from your post history I can see that you're not a shitposter, but I think there's a lot of the humor that's supposed to be there lost in translation god knows where.And yes, there's already a thread for bitcoin memes.Â  I'd think bitcointalk-related ones would be appropriate there as well, though I haven't visited that thread in quite a while.

So this tread was created to put smile on your faces and illustrate some concepts in a different way, which I will be describing a bit about each as the list keeps unfolding.â€¦7.Â Â Â This illustrate that sad face we ironically keep when our posted thread gets no merit after 24hrsâ€¦18.Â Â Â This illustrate that face most users keep when moderator deletes their postâ€¦Â  Â  Â  Â  Â I created all these myself, and I hope they are cool. Thanks I liked 7 and 18 gave you 2 merits.

comments.author: nutildah
comments.body: I honestly don't understand how this forum is profitable for advertisers, yet people still want merits and activity so they can get into signature campaigns... it befuddles me.Quote from: Chlotide on July 20, 2022, 09:53:28 AMThat was my point as well, but without the last part. Guess I should be more straightforward next time Just wanted to point out you have an awesome avatar, props.

comments.author: LFC_Bitcoin
comments.body: Quote from: The Pharmacist on July 19, 2022, 11:25:33 PMI don't have the talent to create memes, but if I did I'd make one that represented "When a long-time member sees a thread started in an obvious attempt to earn merits".None of the above "memes" are in the least bit funny to me, OP.Â  No offense, and I'm sure you worked really hard at producing those, and from your post history I can see that you're not a shitposter, but I think there's a lot of the humor that's supposed to be there lost in translation god knows where.And yes, there's already a thread for bitcoin memes.Â  I'd think bitcointalk-related ones would be appropriate there as well, though I haven't visited that thread in quite a while. The Pharmacist woke up & chose violence I have to admit I didnâ€™t laugh at any of the memes in the OP but I didnâ€™t want to tear the guy to shreds haha.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: This is quite a list, and without any doubt, you really took/spent alot of time to create/put this memes together.It is one thing to have an idea of what to share with the community and it is a different thing all together to know the right place to post that which you think is something worthy of sharing with the community.I believe you would have been appreciated much more if you posted this in the right place, which is the Bitcointalk meme thread, the user in the second comment already gave you the link, I join those who asked to lock this thread, and post anything that has to do with memes, in the Bitcointalk memes thread.By the way, Welldone for trying to put a smile on our faces, but I didn't smile or laugh, not because the memes are bad though, but because am just not in the mood to laugh today. Â Edit:
